snippet: A vote by the European Parliament allows prosecutors in Lyon to proceed against Marine Le Pen, head of the National Front, on charges of violating laws against racial hatred.
abstract: European Parliament votes to lift parliamentary immunity for Marine Le Pen, leader of far-right French National Front, which will allow prosecutors in Lyon to proceed against her on charges of violating laws against racial hatred; Le Pen in December 2010 compared crowds of praying Muslims in France to Nazi occupation.
lead_paragraph: A vote by the European Parliament allows prosecutors in Lyon to proceed against Marine Le Pen, head of the National Front, on charges of violating laws against racial hatred.

headline.main: French Far-Right Leader Loses Parliamentary Immunity
headline.print_headline: France: No More Immunity For a Far-Right Politician
